Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2019 06:38AM 60notpretty wrote: Margot62, I too was feeling exhausted most days about 8-12 months prior to the diagnosis. I kept thinking something must be wrong, but never could figure it out. I now know that is what it was. I have completed my surgeries and am waiting to start radiation, so I will probably continue the fatigue for awhile. I've started anastrozole and my body aches. Not sure if this is just a side effect of the Als or not.
Posts.Title: Exhaustion Before & After Diagnosis Margot62 purplestargazer

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2019 01:26PM 60notpretty wrote: Hi Cindr, I too had a lumpectomy in February and am having sentinel node surgery on Wednesday this week.  They found ILC during the pathology for the lumpectomy for DCIS. I too was DCIS grade 2,  but in my right breast. I've talked with the oncologist for radiation but he hasn't given options yet. We're waiting for the path from the sentinel node surgery and the Oncotype test. I hope all goes well with your surgery and path results. XOXO ((hugs))
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2019 01:51PM 60notpretty wrote: Hi Cindr, Had my sentinel node surgery on Wednesday and they removed 2 and both were negative I go back for follow-up on Thursday for full path results and then on to the radiation oncologist. I'm so ready to get this over with too. So glad they got the pockets drained for you. I know it feels better. So far, so good on mine. I'm back to work today but trying to take it slow. Let me know how it goes moving forward. ((hugs)) to all.
